security: Disclosing the assignment of an intelligence officer under "deep State cover" to Mexico City, including their GS-13 grade, could compromise the officer's cover and put them at risk. It also reveals operational methods and personnel management practices within the CIA, which could be exploited by adversaries. Specifically, the document states: 'It is contemplated that the Subject will be assigned to Mexicity 'co, as GS-13, Intelligence officer, under deep State cover.'
summary: A memo from the CIA Security Officer to the Chief of the Overseas Branch regarding security concurrence for John F. Rittenhouse's conversion to OPC Staff Agent and assignment to Mexico City under deep state cover.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated December 7, 1950, addresses a request from the Chief of the Special Security Branch to the Chief of the Overseas Branch, Employees Division, concerning John F. Rittenhouse (Pseudo - OPC, #23500). The memo indicates that the Security Officer offers no objection to the proposed conversion of Rittenhouse from an OPC Staff Employee to an OPC Staff Agent. The memo also notes Rittenhouse will be assigned to Mexico City as a GS-13 Intelligence Officer operating under deep State cover.
title: Security Concurrence for John F. Rittenhouse Assignment to Mexico City
recipient: Chief, Overseas Branch, Employees Division, SSS
